name: Capital expenditures in the United States and for domestic R&D paid for and performed by the company, by type of expenditure, industry, and company size: 2020
description: Capital expenditures in the United States and for domestic R&D paid for and performed by the company, by type of expenditure, industry, and company size: 2020

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: selected_industry_naics_code_and_company_size
variableMeasured.description: Selected industry, NAICS code, and company size hierarchy

variableMeasured.name: field_used_for_domestic_r_da_totalb_c
variableMeasured.description: Used For Domestic R Da Totalb C

variableMeasured.name: field_used_for_domestic_r_da_land_acquisition
variableMeasured.description: Used For Domestic R Da Land Acquisition

variableMeasured.name: field_used_for_domestic_r_da_buildings_and_land_improvementd
variableMeasured.description: Used For Domestic R Da Buildings And Land Improvementd

variableMeasured.name: field_used_for_domestic_r_da_equipment
variableMeasured.description: Used For Domestic R Da Equipment

variableMeasured.name: field_used_for_domestic_r_da_capitalized_software
variableMeasured.description: Used For Domestic R Da Capitalized Software

variableMeasured.name: field_used_for_domestic_r_da_all_other_and_undistributede
variableMeasured.description: Used For Domestic R Da All Other And Undistributede

notes: Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Beginning in survey year 2018, companies that performed or funded less than $50,000 of R&D were excluded from tabulation. These companies in aggregate represented a very small share of total R&D expenditures in prior years. Had the companies under this threshold been included in the 2018 estimates, they would have contributed approximately $90 million to overall R&D expenditures. Estimates of aggregate capital expenditures would have been similarly affected. Industry classification was based on dominant business code for domestic R&D performance, where available. For companies that did not report business codes, the classification used for sampling was assigned. Excludes data for federally funded research and development centers.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics and U.S. Census Bureau, Business Enterprise Research and Development Survey, 2020.
